review_text: The Beirut Memorial stands as a solemn tribute to the 241 American peacekeepers—220 Marines, 18 sailors, and three soldiers—who tragically lost their lives in the Beirut barracks bombing on October 23, 1983. Located outside the gate of Camp Gilbert H. Johnson, part of Marine Corps Base Camp Lejeune in Jacksonville, North Carolina, the memorial serves as a poignant reminder of the sacrifices made in the line of duty. Each year, it becomes the site of a commemorative ceremony honoring the victims of the devastating attack. The memorial not only marks a significant event in military history but also symbolizes the enduring spirit and resilience of the armed forces.
Excellent piece. Good to have it here
